name: CVE-2012-3324
description: Directory traversal vulnerability in the UTL_FILE module in IBM DB2 and DB2 Connect 10.1 before FP1 on Windows allows remote authenticated users to modify, delete, or read arbitrary files via a pathname in the file field.
pattern: [((software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:ibm:db2:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:ibm:db2_connect:10.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') AND (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_2000:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_vista:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_server_2008:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_7:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_2003_server:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_xp:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*'))]

external_references.description: This object was created using cve2stix from the Signals Corps.
